author: vorot93
content: what is the plan for forkid post-merge? perhaps it will make sense to remove forkid altogether?

author: .fjl
content: I think we still want it. There is no forkID for the merge itself, but we will define one retroactively.

author: .fjl
content: Forks after the merge will also be scheduled by block number, so the forkID system will work.

author: vorot93
content: how do you define one retroactively without breaking the network?

author: .fjl
content: I have not considered it yet. We will find a way to do it for sure. Or not. All I know now is, forkID does not work for the merge because it is not scheduled by block number.

author: .fjl
content: So I guess the simplest solution will be just skipping the merge in the forkID calculation. That's what happens right now at least.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We have a mergeForkBlock, which we will schedule after the merge, basically just an empty fork
